sections.title: About 3D stories
sections.description: The idea for '3D stories' arose from the desire to create a tool that enables a dynamic and fluid presentation of a 3D model while integrating information on the object. Hence we developed an interface for 3D stories, in this case of historic garments from the textile collection at the Germanisches Nationalmuseum Nuremberg, that can be experienced by scrolling.

Two different modes are available: The first approach (Read Story) has a narrative that comments on the 3D object implemented. The reader is guided in identifying the relevant details by the scenographic animation of the 3D objects. The second option allows for free navigation of the 3D model: the user-controlled mode is made available when clicking the ‘Explore’ button.

The project was implemented in a collaboration between the Luxembourg Centre for Contemporary and Digital History Luxembourg (C²DH) and the Urban Complexity Lab (UCLAB) at Potsdam University of Applied Sciences. Kirill Mitsurov (C²DH) created the interface and Marian Dörk and Sabine de Günther (UCLAB) offered data expertise and content for the stories.
The resulting codes are reusable under the licence cc by 4.0. Credits: Daniele Guido (C²DH).
